moves.1. d4:
Too much erorrs             



       Why 1.d4? Normally I always play 1.e4. Oh well. The game has started.
moves.2. Nc3: I thought about playing the Queens Gambit. An excellent opening. But no-this move.
moves.3... Na6: To fast. I suggest 3...Nf6 4.e4 dxe4 5.Nxe4 with a playable game.
moves.4. Nf3: Nf3. Developing a kingside pice when I intend to castle queenside. A mistake but not a fatal one.
moves.4... Nb4: (?) Why move the same piece twice in the opening. Now black will never gat the chamce to seize equality.
moves.5... h5: h5. I think Ammira intends to do is,when thise game reaches an endgame this pawn will queen. However, this game will never reach an engame.
moves.6. Bd3: Change of plan. Castling king side is more safe, I thought.
moves.7. O-O: See .All Ammira's queen side pieces are out and he cannot get to the king side.
moves.8... Ng4: Ng4. Now I know. h5 was to open the h-file after9.h3
moves.9... Nh6: What? He should sac the knight for control of the h-file.
moves.10. Qe2: Preparing my queen for a bloody battle.
moves.10... g6: Looking to fianchetto his dark square bishop.
moves.11... c5: c5 Blunders a knight. I looked at this postition for sveral minutes befor realizing that this was a blunder, not a sacrifice.
moves.14. Nc7+ Kd8: This fork is the fatal decider. Black should resign.
moves.15. Nxa8: I admire Ammiras bravery to play on a rook and a knight down. A loss is inevitable.
moves.16. Rab1: Kicking his queen from defending the d4 pawn.
moves.17. Nxd4: (?) Too greedy. that pawn is mine for sure. I should play Bb5! Giving his king no safe squares.
moves.17... f6: (?) A blunder whuich creates a weakness on the e6 square. Ammira's material defict is beggining to show itself.
moves.19... Kd7 20. Rb2:
(!!) a truly exccelent move which deflects Ammira's queen from Qe6 mate amd threataning
Bb5 mate. Back is lost
